column3: Before examining those reasons , however , it seems to me helpful to review some of the features of legal advice privilege in order to provide a context for the policy reasons underlying the privilege .

column3: First , legal advice privilege arises out of a relationship of confidence between lawyer and client .

column3: Unless the communication or document for which privilege is sought is a confidential one , there can be no question of legal advice privilege arising .

column3: Second , if a communication or document qualifies for legal professional privilege , the privilege is absolute .
column8: lord brown, lord carswell, lord rodger, lord scott

column3: It can not be overridden by some supposedly greater public interest .

column3: It can be waived by the person , the client , entitled to it and it can be overridden by statute -LRB- c/f R -LRB- Morgan Grenfell Ltd -RRB- v Special Commissioner of Income Tax -LSB- 2003 -RSB- 1 AC 563 -RRB- , but it is otherwise absolute .
